summary:
## Trail of Tears

The Trail of Tears was a sad time in American history. The U.S. government forced about 60,000 Native Americans from their homes in the Southeast. They had to move to land west of the Mississippi River. This happened between 1830 and 1850.

The journey was hard. People suffered from sickness, hunger, and cold weather. Many died before they reached their new home. Some historians call this event genocide or ethnic cleansing.
title: Trail of Tears
